channel.title: Need help with my client!
channel.description: i got a Galkons Client base and when i run it, it says this: [IMG]http://i52.tinypic.com/2l9ihbb.jpg[/img] but it gots the EGUI.java there to and it give me this. can someone help??

item.title: Need help with my client!
item.dc:creator: @patargangstar patargangstar
item.description:
@patargangstar wrote:

just a little tip by the way, as i see its better to learn then to spoonfeed,

“Exception in the thread “main” noclassdeffounderror: Egui”

Basically what its telling you is, it cant find the class “egui” which i dont really understand what that is, it might have been a type in the coding if you edited anything.

Check all your paths in your client be sure everything is set correctly.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my client!
item.dc:creator: @Marine5288 Marine5288
item.description:
@Marine5288 wrote:

If this continues to happen, try deleting both of your paths because that’s what worked for me.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help with my client!
item.dc:creator: @Kidpaparoach Kidpaparoach
item.description:
@Kidpaparoach wrote:

Look at your client and look at the name of the gui. Is it named egui, gui, GUI, EGUI? click edit on your run and make sure the EGUI matches the gui used.
Its basically saying it can’t find the file, this is no fault of your own, the programmer should of checked this so maybe your not using the best client you could be if he has made a mistake like this and hasn’t tested it or your winrar(or whatever you use) has missed out the file when it was downloaded.

Read full topic
